tags.description:
If this is the "Keyboard" test suite, you should have the "UI Test App".  Install it as follows:

1. Connect to the internet on your phone via WiFi or Data. 
2. Go to http://mozqa.com/webapi-permissions-tests/ in your B2G Browser.
3. scroll down to "Packaged App Test Case 13"
4. Click "Install Packaged App" button on the page.
5. The "UI Test" app should appear on your homescreen.

(Please disregard this step if this is "Keyboard & Text Handling" or any other suite).

objects.description: To verify Bug 989403, a feature release for FFOS 2.1
objects.name: Repaint transform: scale(X)

steps.expected: Phone is now connected to the App Manager
steps.instruction:
Connect the phone to desktop firefox App Manager
Phone:
Load FFOS 2.1+, then
Go to settings ->Developer -> Debugging via USB 
set 'ADB and DevTools'
Desktop:
Open Firefox, go to Tools -> Web developer -> App Manager
At the bottom, click "Connect to <deviceid>" button
Click OK on the device 

(Help: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/Firefox_OS/Using_the_App_Manager#Debugging)

steps.expected: Calculator app is now loaded
steps.instruction:
Download https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/attachment.cgi?id=8398622, unzip it
In the App Manager, click Apps, then click 'Add Packaged App'.
Go to the unzipped folder of above file, and select 'Open'

steps.expected: The display shows correct value, with no graphical issues
steps.instruction:
Open Calculator App, and do following actions:
type 6 to 7 digit numbers, perform multiplication, division, addition, subtraction
Press C to clear
type 10 digit numbers, and perform multiplication, division, add, sub again

Delete the app from the device

steps.expected:
Calculator app is launched, and in the inspector tab,
<b style="transform: scale(1.2);"> line is shown under Html->body-> div id="display"
steps.instruction:
Go to the unzipped 'application' folder in Step 2.
open calculator.js file in the js folder with a text editor

Change line 23, to following:
var scaleFactor = Math.min(1.2, (screenWidth - 16) / valWidth);
(original)
var scaleFactor = Math.min(1, (screenWidth - 16) / valWidth);

Go to App manager, click 'Add Packaged App' then go to the applications folder, and press open.  Click update button.

Press debug button

steps.expected: The display shows correct value, with no graphical issues
steps.instruction: Repeat Step 3

objects.description:
The rupee symbol appears in all India language keyboards

Please see this issue: https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1029934

Prerequisites: 

1. Get latest Gaia 2.0 from Github
I. If you already have Gaia repository
 -cd into Gaia folder
 -git checkout v2.0
 -git pull

II. If you do not have a Gaia repository downloaded
 -git clone -b v2.0 https://github.com/mozilla-b2g/gaia.git

2. Install the India Keyboards onto the DUT
 -git checkout v2.0
 -adb root
 -GAIA_KEYBOARD_LAYOUTS=en,ta,bn-Probhat,bn-Avro,hi APP=keyboard make install-gaia
 -adb shell stop b2g && adb shell start b2g

Once the Keyboards are installed, check to see that the Rupee symbol appears on the keyboards
objects.name: The rupee symbol appears in all India language keyboards

steps.instruction: Open Settings app> Keyboards> Selected Keyboards.
Enable all the unselected keyboards (which are Tamil, Bengali India, Bengali, and Hindi).
Tap the home button to return to the homescreen.
Open the Messaging app> tap on new message icon.

steps.expected: The ""₹"" symbol is present in place of the ""$"" symbol.
steps.instruction: Tap on ""En""> Tap on 12&

steps.expected: The ""₹"" symbol is present in the list of currencies.
steps.instruction: Tap on ""Ta"">  Tap on 12& button> Long press on ""৳""

steps.expected: The ""₹"" symbol is present in the list of currencies.
steps.instruction: Tap on ""Bn"">  Tap on 12& button> Long press on ""৳""

steps.expected: The "₹" symbol is present in place of the "$" symbol.
steps.instruction: 8) Tap on "Bn">  Tap on 12& button.

tags.description:
If this is the "Keyboard" test suite, you should have the "UI Test App".  Install it as follows:

1. Connect to the internet on your phone via WiFi or Data.

3. scroll down to "Packaged App Test Case 13"
4. Click "Install Packaged App" button on the page.

(Please disregard this step if this is "Keyboard & Text Handling" or any other suite).

Please see issue: https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1030007
objects.name: Framerate does not drop erratically when zooming in and out while recording a video

steps.instruction: Enable ADB Debug on Device and plug into computer.
Enable Frames per second in Developer Menu > Developer HUD.
Launch Video app and toggle to video recording.
Press record button on device.

steps.expected: FPS overlay does not show large drop while zooming during video recording. Video recording itself shows no visible frame drop.
steps.instruction: While video is recording pinch to zoom in and out while paying attention to the FPS.

tags.description:
If this is the "Keyboard" test suite, you should have the "UI Test App".  Install it as follows:

1. Connect to the internet on your phone via WiFi or Data. 
2. Go to http://mozqa.com/webapi-permissions-tests/ in your B2G Browser.
3. scroll down to "Packaged App Test Case 13"
4. Click "Install Packaged App" button on the page.
5. The "UI Test" app should appear on your homescreen.

(Please disregard this step if this is "Keyboard & Text Handling" or any other suite).

objects.description:
Camera viewfinder preview should be smooth when moving the phone around. 

Prerequisite: 

So in order to change the resolution to 480p, we need to build custom gaia.  The steps are following:

clone the gaia repo, and change the following file:
go into gaia/master/apps/camera/js/config/config.js, open it with text editor

Go to ‘exclude’ property where it lists ‘1080p'.  add ‘720p’ in the list, save.

build gaia with make reset-gaia command while the device is connected.  the newly built gaia will be pushed to the device.  Upon reboot, the camera will be defaulted to 480p.

Please see this issue:

https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=988704
objects.name: Camera viewfinder preview should be smooth when moving the phone around

steps.instruction: Change the resolution of the camera to 352X288
Launch the camera app.

steps.expected: The camera preview is smooth and on par with Android.
steps.instruction: Move the viewfinder around observing the speed of the preview.
Now change the resolution 720X480.

steps.expected: The camera preview is smooth and on par with Android.
steps.instruction: Repeat steps 2 and 3.

objects.description:
There are no issues with the video quality of a MP4V-ES.file. 

Pre-requisite: Have Quicktime and VideoLAN Manager installed on Windows with a MP4V-ES file available. 

Please see this issue:

https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1032065
objects.name: RTSP - There are no issues with the video quality of a MP4V-ES.file

steps.instruction: Open MP4V-ES file in QuickTime Player.
Click File -> Export.
Choose Export type "Movie to Hinted Movie".
Verify output file name and change output file type match to match input file type.
Click OK.
On a server capable of RTSP streaming run: % vlc --ttl 12 -vvv --color -I telnet --telnet-password [WhatYourServerPasswordIs] --rtsp-host [WhatYourHostAddressIs]:[WhatPortYouStreamOn]
Once inside the Telnet interface of VideoLAN Manager type: new Test vod enabled.
Then type: setup Test input [VideoFileNameHere.mp4v]
Connect device to WiFi network.
On device direct browser to rtsp://[serverIPAddress]:[StreamingPortNumber]/Test

steps.expected: The streaming quality on both devices is comparable.
steps.instruction: Open same link from step 10 on Android device connected to same WiFi network.

format"

steps.expected: Screen goes back to Settings -> Media storage page with the new selected default media location

objects.description: Verify APZC scrolling works properly with multiple nested frames
objects.name: APZC scrolling with nested frames

steps.expected: When APZC is activated during the scrolling action, the visual indicator notifies the user.  It will show framecounts when things are working normally.
steps.instruction:
Enable visual indicator for APZC in Settings-> Developer options 
(Ref: https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1053992)

steps.expected:
Verify the APZC is turned on, and there is no graphical regression, and no red dot indicator is turned on.

Note: when APZC is not activated, since the scrolling is handled by the main thread, the visual feedback will be jankier (i.e. noticeable stutter when scrolling contents)
steps.instruction:
Go to https://bug1011639.bugzilla.mozilla.org/attachment.cgi?id=8424102 in the browser app, and do scroll.  
Go to http://people.mozilla.org/~bballo/multi-layer-apz.html and do scroll within the rectangle

tags.description:
If this is the "Keyboard" test suite, you should have the "UI Test App".  Install it as follows:

1. Connect to the internet on your phone via WiFi or Data. 
2. Go to http://mozqa.com/webapi-permissions-tests/ in your B2G Browser.
3. scroll down to "Packaged App Test Case 13"
4. Click "Install Packaged App" button on the page.
5. The "UI Test" app should appear on your homescreen.

(Please disregard this step if this is "Keyboard & Text Handling" or any other suite).

objects.name: [Ringtones] Create a Custom Ringtone with mp3 format in 2.0 and upgrade to 2.1

steps.instruction: Flash device to 2.0 version
adb push a mp3 to device

steps.expected: The menu opens and there are options to configure the various sound options on the phone.
steps.instruction: Navigate to the settings app and select "Sound" under the Personalization category.

steps.expected: A menu opens up allowing you to select from "System Ringtones" or "+."
steps.instruction: Under the "Tones" category, select "Manage Ringtones"

steps.expected: The mp3 is listed on the bottom of "Manage Ringtones" page.
steps.instruction:
1. Click the "+" button 
2. Select the mp3 uploaded in step 2
3. Click the check box on the upper right corner
4. Click Save button

steps.expected: Confirm the track you select begins playing each time the phone rings.
steps.instruction: Call the device several times from another phone.

steps.expected: The ringtone you selected should show under the "Ringer" section.
steps.instruction: Inspect the Sound category in the Settings app.

steps.expected: The new ringtone should be listed in "Manage Ringtones" page.
steps.instruction: Use OTA to upgrade to 2.1

objects.description:
Implementation bug: https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1041380

As a user, I want to be made aware that results are loading in the search app when non-local results are still in the process of loading so that I can tell what is happening.

Acceptance Criteria:
1. While e.me or Marketplace results are loading in the search app, a loading indicator is displayed, per UX spec.
2. After scrolling down to load more results from the server, a loading indicator is displayed, per UX spec.
3. After results are loaded in AC1 or AC2, the loading indicator disappears.

See page 14 of v12 of Search App spec: https://mozilla.app.box.com/s/lbw2wzw3p4jvxs24k4sg
See Visual spec: https://mozilla.app.box.com/s/2iocehbfaupyc4g65lkw

objects.description:
update for bug https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1099157

From spec:

Status bar not shown. Scrim appears over homescreen background or application. Keyboard appears, ready for input. Close button shown within search field.

A Settings icon and text “No Internet Connection” is shown in the place where the search suggestions are usually shown.
User can return to originating screen by tapping on Close button.

Tapping on the Settings icon links the user to the Settings app, as per usual offline error handling. When the user is finished with the Settings app flow, they should be returned to the Search app.

objects.description:
On emulator only
https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/Firefox_OS/Using_the_B2G_emulators


1) $git clone git://github.com/mozilla-b2g/B2G.git .
2) $BRANCH=v2.x ./config.sh emulator
3) $ ./build.sh 
4) $./run-emulator.sh
5) Connect to the console of the emulator: $telnet localhost 5554
6) Send a pdu (as follows ) to simulate sending a CBS message to to DUT

CMAS
cbs pdu 011112C005010154741914AFA7C76B9058FEBEBB41E6371EA4AEB7E173D0DB5E9683E8E832881DD6E741E4F7B9D168341A8D46A3D168341A8D46A3D168341A8D46A3D168341A8D46A3D168341A8D46A3D168341A8D46A3D10026
cbs pdu 01112FC005010154741914AFA7C76B9058FEBEBB41E6371EA4AEB7E173D0DB5E9683E8E832881DD6E741E4F7B9D168341A8D46A3D168341A8D46A3D168341A8D46A3D168341A8D46A3D168341A8D46A3D168341A8D46A3D10026
objects.name: Verify that CMAS messages is sent to device

steps.instruction:
Open 'Messaging Settings' from 'Settings' of 'Messages', 
turn ON 'Emergency Alert', and turn OFF 'Cell Broadcast'.
Tap power to show lock screen.

steps.expected: Ok in console, emergency alert shown on lockscreen.

steps.instruction: Slide on lock screen to show home screen.

steps.expected: Message shown on screen.

steps.instruction:
Open 'Messaging Settings' from 'Settings' of 'Messages', 
turn OFF 'Emergency Alert', and turn ON 'Cell Broadcast'.

steps.expected: Emergency alert is NOT shown on device.

objects.description: According to Bug 1033549, the user should be able to track mobile data usage on a per app basis.
objects.name: Mobile data usage is tracked on a per app basis

steps.instruction: Disable Wi-Fi and Cellular data (3G)

steps.expected: Mobile usage and Wi-Fi usage will be reset to 0 MB
steps.instruction: Open Usage App > Settings > Reset
Enable Cellular data on SIM1
Open the Browser App, browse some website.

steps.expected: Only the Browser App has some data usage. Other apps (except System or other background service) has zero data usage.
steps.instruction: Open Usage App and check the mobile data used by the Browser App
Open the Email App, login to a Gmail account, and then sync the inbox.

steps.expected: Only the Email App and the Browser App has some data usage. Other apps (except System or other background service) has zero data usage.
steps.instruction: Open Usage App and check the mobile data used by the Email App

objects.description: Verify that that the sum of each app's mobile data usage is equal to the sum of the total mobile data usage
objects.name: Per-app mobile usage addes up to the total mobile usage

steps.instruction: Disable Wi-Fi and Cellular data (3G).

steps.expected: All mobile data usage should be rest to 0 MB.
steps.instruction: Open Usage App > Settings > Reset.
Enable Cellular data on SIM1
Open the Browser App and browser some website.
Open the Email App, login to a Gmail account and sync the inbox.

steps.expected: The Browser App and Email App, plus the System have used some mobile data.
steps.instruction: Open the Usage App.

steps.expected: The sum should be equal to the total mobile data usage (ignoring roundings. )
steps.instruction: Calculate the sum of the mobile data used by each app, compate the sum with the total mobile data usage.

objects.description:
The user can share all supported image files no matter what their source using E-mail, Wallpaper, Messages and Bluetooth.

Prerequisite:
Attached .jpg is imported to the device as well as all supported image files. Have a good mix of pictures taken from the camera, downloaded from the web and images that were moved over from the desktop onto the SD card. 
(jpeg, png, gif, bmp) and subtypes (progressive jpeg, animated gif, etc.) and a variety of sizes.  A full set of EXIF orientations for jpeg images. 

Please see these issue: 

 https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1039988

https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1070207
objects.name: The user can share all supported image files without issue

steps.expected: The user is presented with the options E-mail, Wallpaper, Messages and Bluetooth transfer.

steps.expected: The image is shared properly without issue.

steps.expected: All supported image types can be shared through Email, Wallpaper, Messages and Bluetooth without issue.
steps.instruction: Repeat steps 1 through 4 covering all the supported image files.

objects.description: This test verifies the feature where the user can tap an area on the viewfinder to change focus to the tapped region.  (when using the back facing camera only)
objects.name: [Camera] Tap to Focus

steps.expected: a red circle appears, then the focus is set to the tapped area, and the circle turns green and  disappears.  The aperture is set to the tapped area as well.
steps.instruction: Open camera app, and tap an area in the viewfinder screen

steps.expected: As in step 1, focus and exposure are set to the tapped area.
steps.instruction: Tap several different regions in the viewfinder screen, including near the edge, center, as well as objects that are near to the camera and far to the camera.

steps.expected: As in step 2, focus and exposure are set to the tapped area.
steps.instruction: zoom in slightly, (1/5 of the slider bar), then repeat step 2.

steps.expected: As in step 2, focus and exposure are set to the tapped area.
steps.instruction: do full zoom in, then repeat step 2.

steps.expected: Verify the pictures are correctly focused to the tapped area
steps.instruction: Zoom out fully, take picture and open the picture in preview

steps.expected: The flash is turned on, and focus and exposure is set to the tapped region as in step 1
steps.instruction: Exit preview, and turn on auto flash.  go to a dark place, and try to focus badly illuminated object by tapping on the screen.

steps.expected: Verify the flash is fired while the picture is taken, and pictures are correctly focused to the tapped area
steps.instruction: Take picture and open the picture in preview

steps.expected: Verify tap to focus is not enabled
steps.instruction: change to the front facing camera and tap to focus

objects.description: Verify the phone can detect presence of single or multiple faces and focus correctly
objects.name: [Camera]Face detection focus

steps.expected: A circle appears to identify the face.  Verify the circle persists as long as the face is shown in the viewfinder, and focus and exposure is set to the detected faces
steps.instruction: Open camera app, and point it towards a human face

steps.expected: Circle tracks the face, tapping shows focus circle, and focuses to the tapped area
steps.instruction: Move the phone so the location of detected face changes.  Tap screen

steps.expected: verify the tapped face in the photo is in focus, and correctly exposed.
steps.instruction: tap face, Take photo, and open in preview

steps.expected: A circle appears to identify the face.  Verify the circle persists as long as the face is shown in the viewfinder, and focus and exposure is set to the detected faces
steps.instruction: zoom in slightly, (1/5 of the zoom slider) and point it towards the face

steps.expected: A circle appears to identify the face.  Verify the circle persists as long as the face is shown in the viewfinder, and focus and exposure is set to the detected faces
steps.instruction: zoom it to maximum, and point it towards the full view of the face

steps.expected: verify the circle appears for each faces, and all detected faces are in focus with correct exposure
steps.instruction: go back to the camera app, and point at multiple faces

steps.expected: Each circle tracks faces,  tapping shows focus circle for the area and sets the focus
steps.instruction: Move the phone so the location of detected face changes.  Tap screen

steps.expected: verify the circle appears for each faces, and all detected faces are in focus with correct exposure
steps.instruction: Zoom in camera but still point to multiple faces.

steps.expected: verify the tapped area in the photo is in focus, and correctly exposed.
steps.instruction: tap a random area, Take photo, and open in preview

steps.expected: verify the face detection circle still correctly identifies faces, but tapping does not show the focus circle
steps.instruction: Change to the front facing camera, tap screen

objects.description: erify that invalid limit values can't be set in GB format
objects.name: Verify that invalid limit values can't be set in GB format

steps.instruction: Open the Cost Control App
Open settings
Tap in the "When use is above"  field
Select "GB" unit

steps.expected: Only "0.01" display in input box . When inputted "0.00", the "0.0" is displayed and input box should be marked invalid (red)
The "Done" button can be clicked,save  0.01 success.
steps.instruction: Try clicking "Done"

steps.expected: Only "999" display in input box. When user type the fourth "9", it can't be inputted
steps.instruction: Type "9999"

steps.expected: The "-" is not shown in the input box
steps.instruction: Type a "-" symbol

steps.expected: The text become "0.01"
steps.instruction: Type ".01"

steps.expected: The text become "0.11
The value should be valid (not red).
steps.instruction: Type "0.07"

steps.expected: It should go back to the setting page, the "When use is above" field shows "0.07GB"
steps.instruction: Click "Done"

objects.description:
This test is to verify user cannot lock device remotely in case invalid SMS is sent to the device.

PRECONDITIONS
=============
* activate some of the remote privacy protections – see [test](https://moztrap.mozilla.org/manage/case/14770/)
* make sure phone has enough credit to send back SMS
objects.name: User cannot lock device via SMS with invalid SMS

steps.expected:
Verify that:

* when SMS is received it does not change actual phone’s state
* SMS with expected response is sent back from the device:
 * 1: no response
 * 2: no response
 * 3: no response
steps.instruction:
Send below listed SMS one after another:

* 1: does not start with “RP” keyword followed by blank
* 2: does not use any supported command
* 3: does not contain valid passphrase

objects.description:
This test is to verify user is able to lock & locate device remotely in case valid SMS is sent to the device.

PRECONDITIONS
=============
* “Remote Locate” is activated – see this [test](https://moztrap.mozilla.org/manage/case/14770/)
* make sure phone has enough credit to send back SMS
objects.name: User is able to lock & locate device via SMS

steps.expected:
After SMS is received, verify that:

* the phone gets locked with possibility to unlock it only with passcode
* you receive back one SMS with text “Your device coordinates are @<GEOCOORDINATES> and your device was locked. You can unlock it with your passcode.”
steps.instruction: Send an SMS to your device:  “RP locate YOURPASSPHRASE”

objects.description:
This test is to verify user is able to lock & ring device remotely in case valid SMS is sent to the device.

PRECONDITIONS
=============
* “Remote Ring” is activated – see this [test](https://moztrap.mozilla.org/manage/case/14770/)
* make sure phone has enough credit to send back SMS
objects.name: User is able to lock & ring device via SMS

steps.expected:
After SMS is received, verify that:

* the phone gets locked with possibility to unlock it only with lock code
* phone starts ringing at the loudest level even if the phone is muted 
* you receive back one SMS with text “Your device should ring now and was locked. You can unlock it with your passcode.”
steps.instruction: Send an SMS to your device:  “RP ring YOURPASSPHRASE”

objects.description:
https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=960337

As a user, I want to be able to share my music with my friends via NFC, bluetooth, MMS or email

Acceptance Criteria:

1. The user navigates to the share option of the music app
2. A screen with various sharing options should show up: Email, Bluetooth, MMS, NFC
3. Select one of the sharing options and see if sharing a music was successful
objects.name: Share a music with another user - MMS

steps.expected: The song is shown on screen with the two overlays on the image.  The top overlay contains the share icon on the right side
steps.instruction: Open Music app, and select a song to play

steps.expected: Another window opens allowing you to select from a number of options, including: E-mail, Ringtones, Messages and Bluetooth Transfer.
steps.instruction: Tap the Share icon

steps.expected: A "New Message" window should open up in the Message App with the ringtone attached.
steps.instruction: Select the "Messages" button.

steps.expected: Confirm you can receive the music and can download the file to your device.
steps.instruction: Send the MMS to another device.

objects.description:
This test is to verify that user may allow applications to access information about their current location but specific blur is applied for location information to not reveal actual location.

Preconditions: 

* user has enabled location accuracy - see this [test](https://moztrap.mozilla.org/manage/case/14711/)
* user allowed access to geolocation for 2 applications
objects.name: User is able to set blur for location accuracy

steps.instruction: Launch Privacy Panel application from Settings>Privacy Panel
Select “Location Accuracy” menu item

steps.expected: Verify that expected screen according to UX Spec document is being displayed: "ALA-3"
steps.instruction: From the value selector select value “Adjustment” and press "OK"

steps.expected: Verify that minimum accuracy value is 500 m
steps.instruction: Move the slider so that it reaches left limit value

steps.expected: Verify that maximum accuracy value is 1000 km
steps.instruction: Move the slider so that it reaches right limit value
Test each distance for below application

steps.expected: A map is presented.
steps.instruction: Launch the Browser app and go to google map

steps.expected:
1. The current location will be located.
2. The location should be followed by above blur distance setting.
steps.instruction: Tap the current location icon.

steps.instruction: Open camera app

steps.expected: a white focus circle reappears, and after locking the focus, it turns green and disappears.  Focus circle should reappear and lock the focus on the center of the screen.  both focus and exposure are set on the center
steps.instruction: Move the camera around to change focus

steps.expected: Focus circle should reappear and lock the focus on the center of the screen  Focus circle should reappear and lock the focus on the center of the screen.    both focus and exposure are set on the center
steps.instruction: Change to video mode

steps.expected: Verify the video is in focus
steps.instruction: take video clip, and playback

steps.expected: Verify the center of the picture is in focus and correctly exposed
steps.instruction: Switch to photo mode, and take shots after the focus is locked

steps.expected: Focus circle should reappear and lock the focus on the center of the screen.   both focus and exposure are set on the center
steps.instruction: zoom in slightly, and (about 1/5th in the zoom slider) check for AF to activate

steps.expected: Focus circle should reappear and lock the focus on the center of the screen.    both focus and exposure are set on the center

steps.expected: Focus circle should reappear and lock the focus on the center of the screen.    both focus and exposure are set on the center
steps.instruction: Fully zoom out, and check for AF to activate

objects.description:
User should be able to advance the video by pressing Forward button.

Refer to https://bug951025.bugzilla.mozilla.org/attachment.cgi?id=8385749 for UX spec
objects.name: Verify video control "Forward"

steps.expected: The video application launches.
steps.instruction: Launch the video application.

steps.expected: The video you selected should begin playing.
steps.instruction: Select a video to play from the file browser, with the duration longer than a minute or so

steps.expected: The video should advance forward by 10 seconds in the video, and if it has reached the end of the file in the process, the slider should be at the end of the slider
steps.instruction: Tap forward button during the playback

steps.expected: The video should pause, then advance forward by10 seconds and in paused state
steps.instruction: Tap pause, then tap forward button during the playback

steps.expected: The video should skip 10 seconds for every second the button was held, and resume playback on +30 seconds in relation to the previous position.  And if it has reached the end of the file in the process, the slider should be at the end of the slider
steps.instruction: While playing, hold the forward button for 3 seconds

objects.description:
User should be able to rewind the video by tapping the Rewind button
The UX specification is here:
https://bug951025.bugzilla.mozilla.org/attachment.cgi?id=8385749
objects.name: Verify video control "Rewind"

steps.expected: The video application launches.
steps.instruction: Launch the video application.

steps.expected: The video you selected should begin playing.
steps.instruction: Select a video (longer than a minute of playing time) to play from the file browser

steps.expected:
The video should advance backward in the video by 10 seconds, and if the video hasn't been playing for more than 10 seconds, it should set the slider to the beginning of the video
after the rewind is done, the video should resume playback
steps.instruction: Select the player controls at the bottom and tap the rewind button

steps.expected: The video should advance backward in the video by 10 seconds for each second the button is held.  If the video hasn't been playing for more than 10 seconds, it should set the slider to the beginning of the video
steps.instruction: Set the slider to the end, and hold rewind button for 3 seconds

steps.expected: The video should advance backward in the video by 10 seconds for each tap and resume playback.   If the video hasn't been playing for more than 10 seconds, it should set the slider to the beginning of the video
steps.instruction: Press pause button and tap rewind button continuously during the playback

objects.description:
Verify that all strings are translated into the locale you are testing. 
If you find an untranslated string, look at the same string in a pseudolocale (preferably Accented English).
If the string appears in  normal English, it is hard-coded and not localizable.
File a bug under the "Firefox OS" component and add the keyword "l12y".
If the string appears in a pseudolocale, then the localizer hasn't got to it yet. Please don't file a bug.

steps.instruction: Click settings > tap "When use is above"  > tap the number input field > input 99 > Tap "GB"

steps.expected:
"When use is above" is set to 99MB.
In the notification bar, the usage module shows "Data Limit (99.00 MB)".
The graph has a red horizontal line at 99 MB.
steps.instruction: Tap "Done" > tap "Done" on settings page

steps.expected:
"When use is above" is disabled.
In the notification bar, the usage module shows "0.00 B".
The graph has no red horizontal line.
steps.instruction: Tap settings > disable "Data use alert" > tap "Done"

objects.description:
Places to check for usage numbers:  
  * WiFi: usage app graph and total, usage app settings  
  * Mobile data: usage app graph and total, usage app settings, notification bar, per-app list
objects.name: 3G and WiFi usage can be reset

steps.expected: The usage of WiFi and mobile data are larger than zero
steps.instruction: Browser some website (say, https://www.mozilla.org/) using both WiFi and mobile data

steps.expected: The time in usage app settings > Data usage will be "[Yesterday] - TODAY, hh:mm [AM/PM]" (e.g. "Jan, 1 - TODAY, 11:02 AM")
steps.instruction: Set the system time foward for one day (e.g. Jan 1 -> Jan 2)

steps.expected:
1. WiFi usages are reset to 0.
2. Mobile usage remains it original value (> 0). 
3. Time in settings > Data usage remains its original value.
steps.instruction: Tap settings > Reset > Reset Wi-Fi usage

steps.expected: The usage of WiFi and mobile data are larger than zero
steps.instruction: Browser some website (say, https://www.mozilla.org/) using WiFi and mobile data

steps.expected:
1. Mobile usages are reset to 0.
2. Wi-Fi usage remains it original value (> 0). 
3. Time in settings > Data usage remains its original value.
steps.instruction: Tap settings > Reset > Reset mobile usage

steps.expected: The usage of WiFi and mobile data are larger than zero
steps.instruction: Browser some website (say, https://www.mozilla.org/) using WiFi and mobile data

steps.expected:
1. Both mobile and Wi-Fi usages are reset to 0.
2. Time in settings > Data usage becomes "TODAY, [current time]." (e.g. "TODAY, 11:30 AM")
steps.instruction: Tap settings > Reset > Reset mobile & Wi-Fi data

objects.description: Ensure user is able to utilize Facial Recognition and the tap to focus features appropriately with the Camera App.
objects.name: [Camera] Take pictures using Face recognition and Tap to Focus

steps.expected: Camera App launches and is displayed properly
steps.instruction: Launch Camera App

steps.expected: A box encircles each face upon recognition and tracks their movements
steps.instruction: Use view finder to locate fellow testers faces

steps.expected: The photo is saved to gallery and focus is placed on the recognized face
steps.instruction: Take a photo with a face recognized

steps.expected: Camera App responds appropriately
steps.instruction: Repeat Step 1, and use view finder to locate a view with objects in foreground and background

steps.expected: The view finder focuses on the object in the background instead.
steps.instruction: When there is an auto-focus of an object in the foreground, tap on an object in the background.

steps.expected: The photo is saved to gallery and auto-focus did not return the focus to the object in the foreground.  The object in the background is the focal point.
steps.instruction: Take a picture with the focus on an object in the background

objects.description: You may need to refrence to the latest UX documentation
objects.name: The colors changes to reflect the data limit will/has been reached

steps.instruction: Open the Usage app. Reset the data usage.

steps.expected: The figure shows no limit line (red dash). The usage in notification bar is in white text.
steps.instruction: Enable 3G and browse some website to generate some 3G traffic (must be between 100 KB to 999 GB). As an example, suppose ~1 MB of 3G data was used.
Disable 3G to stop the usage number from changing

steps.expected: The graph shows a limit line at 1.1 MB, the 20% area below the line is marked orange. The "xx.xx KB available" text in notification bar is marked orange.
steps.instruction: Open settings > Enable "Data user alert" > Set "When use is above" to about 10% higher than the current usage. For example if 1 MB was used, set limit to 1.1 MB.

steps.expected: In the graph, the area above the limit line is marked red. The "xx.xx KB over limit" text in the notification bar is marked red.
steps.instruction: Set "When use is above" below the current usage. For example, set limit to 0.9 MB.

objects.name: [NFC] Shrinking UI shows correctly when keyboard shows up

steps.instruction: Enable NFC on both phones
Open a website and focus on textbox that would show keyboard

steps.expected: Shrinking UI shows correctly without any truncate
steps.instruction: Tap 2 phones together and check the shrinking UI

objects.name: Usage time - App usage information is sent to server using WIFI

steps.instruction:
1. Open settings app
2. Go to Screen lock
3. Enable screen lock

steps.expected: WLAN can be connected
steps.instruction:
1. Open Settings app
2. Go to Wi-Fi
3. Connect to a WLAN
Reboot device
Unlock the screen when device is booted

steps.expected: The information should be sent to server
steps.instruction: Open Settings app again and wait for the seconds you set for AUM.REPORT_INTERVAL in apps/system/js/app_usage_metrics.js and check the metrics server

steps.expected: A list of logs will be shown in right hand side
steps.instruction:
Go to metric server
In left hand side, click Main > Logs
Expand the log
